answers.answer: Hi there. In pregnancy there is aortocaval compression in the 2nd trimester due to the gravid uterus which causes supine hypotension when the inferior vena cava gets compressed. Your passing out during passing motion could be due to a similar mechanism due to exertion at passing bowel movements.  It could be orthostatic hypotension due to autonomic variability in pregnancy. Show yourself to a gynecologist for assessment of blood pressure and rule out any pregnancy-induced hypertension. Gestational diabetes also needs to be ruled ou.t take care.
Thank You very much will followyour advice.

Hi there. Thanks for posting in. yes, you need a gynecologist to see you as soon as possible. I hope you are taking a well-balanced and nutritious diet suitable for the changed and increased new needs. Headaches and dizziness need to be seen against pregnancy-induced hypertension. This is in addition to the contents of my last mail. You are welcome to post back any further clarification after you meet your doctor. Take care.

question: pregnat and passing out during bowel movment then headache and weakness
title: passing out during bowel movement
